ARABIC: ٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say, 'Shall I tell you of something better than that?' Those who have taqwa will have Gardens with their Lord, with rivers flowing under them, remaining in them timelessly, for ever, and purified wives, and the Pleasure of Allah. Allah sees His slaves:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: who say: "O Lord, we believe; forgive our trespasses and save us the torment of Hell."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: These are the ones who pray: 'Our Lord! We do indeed believe, so forgive us our sins and keep us safe from the chastisement of the Fire';
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Such will be the reward of) those who say, "Lord, we have believed in you. Forgive us our sins and save us from the torment of fire,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Those who say, “Our Lord! we have accepted faith, so forgive us our sins and save us from the punishment of fire.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Those who say: "Our Lord! We have indeed believed, so forgive us our sins and save us from the punishment of the Fire."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Those who say: Our Lord! surely we believe, therefore forgive us our faults and save us from the chastisement of the fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: who say, 'Our Lord, we believe; forgive us our sins, and guard us against the chastisement of the Fire' --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Those who say: Our Lord! Lo! we believe. So forgive us our sins and guard us from the punishment of Fire;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: those who say, "Lord, we believe in You, forgive us our sins and keep us from the punishment of the Fire,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Those who say our Lord! verify we! we have believed, wherefore forgive us our sins, and protect us from the torment of the Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Those who say, ‘Our Lord! Indeed, we have faith. So forgive us our sins, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Namely), those who say: "Our Lord! we have indeed believed: forgive us, then, our sins, and save us from the agony of the Fire;"-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Those who say: "Our Lord! We have indeed believed, so forgive us our sins and save us from the punishment of the Fire."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Those are they who say: 'Lord, we believe in You, forgive us our sins and save us from the punishment of the Fire',
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Those who say, “Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us our sins, and save us from the suffering of the Fire.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Those who say, "Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [3:16] Those (alladhīna is either an adjectival qualification of, or a substitution for, the previous alladhīna) who say: “O, Our Lord, we believe, in You and in Your Prophet; so forgive us our sins, and guard us from the chastisement of the Fire”.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah then proceeds to describe them, saying: (Those who say) in the life of this world: (Our Lord!) our Lord! (Lo! we believe) in You and in Your Messenger. (So forgive us our sins) that we committed in the pre- Islamic period as well as after the advent of Islam (and guard us from the punishment of Fire) drive away from us the punishment of hell;
